Perform_HyperStroke_MRI.title: Perform HyperStroke MRI Protocol
Perform_HyperStroke_MRI.content: $newList$DWI, FLAIR, and T2* or SWI$newLine$$newList$Optional: Time-of-flight head MRA$newLine$Discuss MRI and tPA eligibility with senior and ED.$newLine$Give IV Thrombolytic?

Renturn_To_Decision_Tree.content: Return to decision algorithm and treat based on time from LKN.

Are_You_Confident_This_Is.title: Are you confident this is a stroke mimic?

No_Stroke.title: Stroke Not Suspected
No_Stroke.content: Triage per patient's diagnosis and necessary level of care

Would_You_Give_This_Patient_IV_Thromboly.title: Would you give this patient IV thrombolytic or perform thrombectomy if you did not have access to hyperacute MRI?

Return_To_LKN.title: Return to LKN Decision Box
Return_To_LKN.content: LKN Decision box does not exist as of yet

Discuss_Hyperacute_MRI_To_Rule_Out_Strok.title: Discuss hyperacute MRI to rule-out stroke with Chief Resident or Stroke Attending. Go for hyperacute MRI?

Move_To_MRI_Zone_2.title: Move to MRI Zone 2
Move_To_MRI_Zone_2.content: Discuss plan with Chief and ED attending (758-6903); Confirm thrombolytic dose / weight with ED RN “Safety time-out”$newLine$Ask RN to get IV thrombolytic (and BP meds if needed) from Pyxis located in MRI Re-examine pt and check vital signs; Review thrombolytic inclusion /exclusion criteria.  If patient is still a candidate, administer IV thrombolytic Bolus in MRI, return to ED to begin infusion

Perform_Post_Thrombolytic_BP_Monitoring_.content: Perform post-thrombolytic BP Monitoring and complications$newLine$Admit to NeuroICU or Stepdown Unit as appropriate

Triage_per_patient_diagnosis_and_level_o.content: Triage per patient’s diagnosis and level of care needed

Review_Wake_Up_Criteria.title: Review WAKE-UP CRITERIA
Review_Wake_Up_Criteria.content: Does patient meet criteria for WAKE UP/unwitnesed onset hyperacute MRI and is the patient < 4.5 hours from symptom discovery?

Decision_Yes_Order_And_Perform.title: Decision “YES” for Hyperacute MRI
Decision_Yes_Order_And_Perform.content: Notify RN to prepare pt for HMRI $newLine$Notify ED MD to order HyperStroke MRI in Epic $newLine$Complete and Fax MR Screening Sheet (747-4271) $newLine$Call MRI Charge Tech (362-1676) "On our way for HMRI" $newLine$Travel quickly to MRI suite

Order_And_Perform_Hyperacute_MRI.title: Order and Perform Hyperacute MRI
Order_And_Perform_Hyperacute_MRI.content: Notify RN to prepare pt for HMRI $newLine$Notify ED MD to order HyperStroke MRI in Epic $newLine$Complete and Fax MR Screening Sheet (747-4271) $newLine$Call MRI Charge Tech (362-1676) "On our way for HMRI" $newLine$Travel quickly to MRI suite

Arrived_MRI_Zone_2.title: Arrived MRI Zone 2
Arrived_MRI_Zone_2.content: Place Belongings in Locker or on Hook, Remove all Metal, Badges, etc.$newLine$SAFETY first! Keep the phone/pager in scanner control room (zone 3)$newLine$Assist Transfer to MRI Stretcher and attach vital signs, monitor if needed

Move_To_MRI_Zone_34.title: Move to MRI Zone 3/4
Move_To_MRI_Zone_34.content:
Perform HyperStroke MRI Protocol (~6 min)$newLine$$newList$DWI, FLAIR, and T2* or SWI $newLine$$newList$Optional: Time-of-flight head MRA - Consider in case of flucuating sympots or concern for basilar artery occlusion, and when CTA has not already been done. 
$newLine$Is DWI positive, FLAIR negative and consistent with patient's presenting deficits? Review images with NeuroRad Fellow at scanner (night, call 508-3767)

Discuss_MRI_With_Chief.content:
Discuss MRI with Chief and Stroke Fellow / attending and decision for thrombolytic; Re-examine pt and check vital signs to ensure eligibility, administer IV thrombolytic Bolus in MRI, return to ED to begin infusion. 
$newLine$Eligible for thrombolytic for wake-up / unwitnessed stroke onset within 4.5 hrs from symptom discovery?

Discuss_Plan_With_ED_Attending.content: Discuss plan with ED attending (758-6903); Confirm thrombolytic dose / weight with ED RN "Safety time-out"$newLine$ Ask RN to get IV thrombolytic (and BP meds if needed) from Pyxis located in MRI.  Give IV Thrombolytic bolus in MRI and return to ED TCC for infusion .

Perform_post_thrombolytic_BP.content: Perform post-thrombolytic BP Monitoring and complications$newLine$Admit to NeuroICU or Stepdown Unit as appropriate

Give_TPA.title: Give TPA
Give_TPA.content: I don't know how, the doc is confusing, but you should give TPA NOW!

Is_Patient_Eligible_For_IV_Alt.title: Is patient eligible for IV Thrombolytic?

POTENTIAL_IV_TPA_CANDIDATE.content: Potential IV tPA candidate per WAKE-UP protocol

POTENTIAL_THROMBECTOMY_CANDIDATE_IF_NOT_.content: Potential thrombectomy candidate. If not eligible, consider WAKE-UP protocol

POTENTIAL_WAKEUP_MRI_CANDIDATE_Ca_Da.content: Potential IV tPA candidate per WAKE-UP protocol

NIHSS_GREATER_THAN_6_INFO.title: NIHSS ≥ 6
NIHSS_GREATER_THAN_6_INFO.content: Potential IV tPA candidate and thrombectomy candidate

CONFIRM_NO_LVO.title: Confirom no LVO after review of CTA by Neuroadiology Attending and Stroke Chief/Fellow/Attending

POST_THROMBOLYTIC_MONITORING_IF_APPLICAB.content: Triage per patient's diagnosis and necessary level of care

CHIEF_TO_CALL_NEUROIR.content: Chief to alert stroke fellow/attending for all LVOs and call NeuroIR. Take patient up to INR Suite. Admit to NeuroICU as appropriate

TAKE_PATIENT_UP_TO_INR_SUITE.content: Take patient up to INR Suite with Patient RN for thrombectomy. Post-procedure, admit to NeuroICU as appropriate

GO_TO_ENDOVASCULAR_PROTOCOL_2.title: Go to Endovascular Protocol
GO_TO_ENDOVASCULAR_PROTOCOL_2.content: Is patient eligible for thrombectomy?$newLine$ - Functional status of patient (mRS<3)?$newLine$ - No large,evolving infarct on CT and ASPECTS ≥ 6?$newLine$Rapid criteria: $newLine$$newList$ Core infarct volumes ≤ 70mL$newLine$$newList$ Core/Perfusion mismatch volume ≥ 15mL$newLine$$newList$Core/Perfusion mismatch ratio ≥ 1.8

CHIEF_TO_ALERT_STROKE_FELLOW.title: Cheif to alert stroke felow/attending for all LVOs and call NeuroIR. Take patient up to INR Suite. Admite to NeuroICU as appropriate.

GO_TO_ENDOVASCULAR_PROTOCOL_3.title: Go to Endovascular Protocol
GO_TO_ENDOVASCULAR_PROTOCOL_3.content: Is patient eligible for thrombectomy?$newLine$ - Functional status of patient (mRS<3)?$newLine$ - No large, evolving infarct on CT and ASPECTS ≥ 6?$newLine$Rapid criteria: $newLine$$newList$ Age < 80: core infarct volumes ≤ 30 mL$newLine$$newList$ Age  ≥ 80: core infarct volumes ≤ 20 mL

GIVE_IV_THROMBOLYTIC_BOLUS_IN_MRI.content: Give IV Thrombolytic bolus in MRI and return to ED TCC for infusion

CHIEF_TO_ALERT_STROKE_FELLOW_ATTENDING.content: Chief to alert stroke fellow/attending for all LVOs and call NeuroIR. Decision Go for thrombectomy?

TAKE_PATIENT_UP_TO_INR.content: Take patient up to INR Suite with Patient RN for thrombectomy. Post-procedure, admit to NeuroICU as appropriate.
